meanings.definition: A building or group of buildings used to house soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers gathered at the barrack before heading out on their mission.
meanings.sent2: The new recruits were assigned to the barrack closest to the training grounds.
meanings.sent3: During the barracks inspection, the sergeant found a hidden stash of snacks.
meanings.sent4: The barrack stood tall and proud, a symbol of military strength.
meanings.sent5: The barrack echoed with the sounds of soldiers preparing for battle.

meanings.definition: To shout in a loud, angry way.
meanings.sent1: The coach would barrack at the players when they made mistakes on the field.
meanings.sent2: The protesters began to barrack against the new policy outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The toddler started to barrack at the top of his lungs when he couldn't find his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The angry customer began to barrack at the poor service he received at the restaurant.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to barrack to get the attention of the noisy classroom.
